content:
Diagnosis:
Rectal adenocarcinoma, poorly differentiated
Initial staging T3N2M1 (liver metastases)
Post-neoadjuvant staging ypT3N1M0
RAS wild-type

Previous Treatment:
Neoadjuvant FOLFOX completed March 2024
Liver resection April 2024
Total mesorectal excision May 2024

Current Situation:
Post-operative recovery

MDT Discussion 15 May 2024:
Case presented with post-operative histology and imaging

Histology shows:
ypT3N1 (2/12 nodes positive)
CRM negative (minimum 2mm)
EMVI negative
Complete pathological response in liver specimen

Imaging:
Post-operative CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of residual or new disease

MDT Recommendation:
Proceed with adjuvant FOLFOX to complete total 6 months of perioperative chemotherapy
CT surveillance scan in 3 months
Follow up in surgical clinic in 2 weeks for wound check
Oncology review prior to cycle 1 adjuvant treatment

Performance status remains 1
No post-operative complications

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma, ypT3N1 (2/12 nodes positive), CRM negative, EMVI negative

cancer_timeline.value: Complete pathological response in liver specimen
Post-operative CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of residual or new disease

status_updates.value: Rectal cancer with liver metastases showing excellent response to neoadjuvant therapy and surgery, with complete pathological response in liver
Plan to proceed with adjuvant FOLFOX to complete total 6 months of perioperative chemotherapy
Follow up in surgical clinic in 2 weeks for wound check, oncology review prior to cycle 1 adjuvant treatment
